comment: Easy A class. She is not a harsh grader by any means. Content was meh, most everything is just a link to another source. Felt like busy work

Course long group project where we created a fake product/company & min 1 discussion per week. Was given three tries on every quiz/test. Didn't have a course schedule or grade breakdown. Would show up to class to find out what was due that week. Kept referring to the class as technical writing but it's intro to digital media.

As a Psych major, I didn't know what to expect with this "Technical Writing" course when I registered, but I actually really enjoyed the course content and I feel like I will use what I learned a lot in the future. There are a lot of assignments compared to my other courses but I wouldn't say they were difficult, just time consuming. She's great!
If you have the chance to take one of her classes, do it! She cares about her student's success. It is a very easy course.

Professor B is so incredible, if you have the chance to take her do it!!! The work isn't difficult and you can knock out the week's work in just a day. The quizzes give you three tries and it tells you what you got wrong each try. No need to buy the textbook there is a free one she provides. No final just a few short writing assignments! Take her!!

Very good professor. Go to class as it is needed for your overall grades. 
She always make anecdotes about her life related to the course.

Great professor and I would take her again, but GOOD LORD THE AMOUNT OF DISCUSSION POSTS.
Most of the assignments were just discussion posts, with the occasional assignment that actually had you put together a document and submit it. All you really need for this class is Google and Word...you'll see what I mean.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Lots of group work. Very very easy class. She's a lenient grader too.
Mrs. B is awesome! She is easy to work with and makes lectures fun. There was a lot of homework, but she was generous with grades. Would recommend to anyone needing to take TCOM.

I absolutely adore Professor Bellisario. She is willing to help as long as you show that you're putting in effort. The class material is very helpful. She will help you with creating a proper resume and cover letter. Please take any class you can with her! Highly recommend!!!

BEST PROFESSOR EVER! She was so funny and caring. Lectures were amazing and she provided students with so much useful, applicable, and relevant information! Exams are easy and homework isn't bad. She is willing to work with students to help them succeed in any way she can. Very personable and kind! Couldn't recommend more!
She is a great professor and very caring for her students. Three assignments for every week are a bit much, though.
One of the best professors I've ever had. She is very easy going and the class is an easy A!

Professor Bellisario is a sweetheart. Her quizzes were so easy, and she was always lenient with submitting late work. No group work at all for her online class. She is the best TCOM professor you could ever have.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Jeannie is the best! She is honest, caring, understanding, and down right cool! She is forgiving with late work, so no stress if you forget to turn in an assignment. This class has a lot of busy work, but she makes it as easy as possible for her students. Online quizzes once a week with T/F questions and "Weekly Web Work." No complaints, take her!

Prof. Bellisario is the best TCOM professor. I really enjoyed her class. Although there was a lot of work, she made it so reasonable. The group team is so much fun. I also made a pretty good connection with a few people in the class. I learned so many new skills that I never would have if I didn't take her class. Just make sure don't procrastinate.
